channel.title: Efficient or not?

item.title: Efficient or not?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

something like this situation

[code=java]
public class Switch {

public static void main(final String... args) {
	final int month = 8;
	String monthString;
	switch (month) {
	case 1:
		monthString = "January";
		break;
	case 2:
		monthString = "February";
		break;
	case 3:
		monthString = "March";
		break;
	case 4:
		monthString = "April";
		break;
	case 5:
		monthString = "May";
		break;
	case 6:
		monthString = "June";
		break;
	case 7:
		monthString = "July";
		break;
	case 8:
		monthString = "August";
		break;
	case 9:
		monthString = "September";
		break;
	case 10:
		monthString = "October";
		break;
	case 11:
		monthString = "November";
		break;
	case 12:
		monthString = "December";
		break;
	default:
		monthString = "Invalid month";
		break;
	}
	System.out.println(monthString);
}

@SuppressWarnings("unused")
private void noSwitch() {
	final int month = 8;
	if (month == 1) {
		System.out.println("January");
	} else if (month == 2) {
		System.out.println("February");
	}
}
/**
 * And so on...
 */

} [/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Efficient or not?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

imsuperman05:

Aren’t switch statements much cleaner then if(c.playerRights?

They are, but you shouldn’t have to use multiple case’s in a yell command. Nor is using a case in a yell command needed.

item.title: Efficient or not?
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“Coelho, post:8, topic:413074”][quote author=ExtremeX-Scape™ link=topic=514547.msg3735331#msg3735331 date=1314915775]
Personally… I would do the command like this in project insanity

		if (inputString.startsWith("yell")) {
			try {
				final String[] r = { "Player", "Mod", "Admin", "Owner" };
				final String m = inputString.substring(5);
				for (final Player player : PlayerHandler.players) {
					if (player != null) {
						final Client Player = (Client) player;
						if (c.privilage == 0) {
							Player.sendMessage(r[0] + " - " + c.playerName + ": " + m);
						}
					}
				}
			} catch (Exception e) {
				System.out.println("Wrong usage ::" + inputString);
				e.printStackTrace();
			}
		}

[/quote]
You should catch the exception a little bit better or not print the stack trace. Naming conventions are a bit bleh too.

Also it just might be myself being stupid, but I would concat the string before going into the loop. Probably doesn’t even matter in the scheme of things.[/quote]

I would have used the catch better, but I modified it quickly because I’m not the one whos going to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: Efficient or not?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“ExtremeX-Scape™, post:7, topic:413074”]Personally… I would do the command like this in project insanity

if (inputString.startsWith("yell")) { try { final String[] r = { "Player", "Mod", "Admin", "Owner" }; final String m = inputString.substring(5); for (final Player player : PlayerHandler.players) { if (player != null) { final Client Player = (Client) player; if (c.privilage == 0) { Player.sendMessage(r[0] + " - " + c.playerName + ": " + m); } } } } catch (Exception e) { System.out.println("Wrong usage ::" + inputString); e.printStackTrace(); } } [/quote]
You should catch the exception a little bit better or not print the stack trace. Naming conventions are a bit bleh too.

Also it just might be myself being stupid, but I would concat the string before going into the loop. Probably doesn’t even matter in the scheme of things.
EDIT: Maybe make a method in the world for global messaging and region messages?

Read full topic

A switch isn’t the best way to do that either…

What would be better?

item.title: Efficient or not?
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

I noticed how DSPK has such shitty commands… i might dl DSPK and rewrite most of DSPK commands, and methods.
Here’s a yell command i just made. Tell me it’s efficient or at least better than before.

if(playerCommand.startsWith("yell")) { String[] rank = {"Player","Mod","Admin","Owner"}; String[] icons = {"<mod=1>","<mod=2>","<mod=3>"}; String message = playerCommand.substring(5); for (final Player player : PlayerHandler.players) { if (player != null) { final Client c2 = (Client) player; switch(c.playerRights) { case 0: c2.sendMessage("["+rank[0]+"]"+c.playerName+": "+message); break; case 1: c2.sendMessage("["+rank[1]+"]"+icons[0]+""+c.playerName+": "+message); break; case 2: c2.sendMessage("["+rank[2]+"]"+icons[1]+""+c.playerName+": "+message); break; case 3: c2.sendMessage("["+rank[3]+"]"+icons[2]+""+c.playerName+": "+message); break; } } } }

Read full topic
